Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory1262.jpg'}
{3: 'After killing Eve, the leader, Vera slaughters every Hetero-Creature in sight, carving a path forward with brutal efficiency.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'After just three minutes, Vera emerges from the mist of blood.'}
{3: 'One step, two steps, she carries her lance behind her, treading through the slurry of Hetero-Creature remains as she slowly approaches you, stopping exactly three steps away.'}
{3: 'She suddenly remembers something and touches her collarbone, where a red light pulses beneath her skin.'}

{3: 'You regard the figure before you with complicated emotions—memories of your shared past remain hopelessly fragmented and blurred. Despite recognizing this gap in your memory, you decide to speak first.'}
{2: "Vera, it's been a long—", 3: '16'}
{3: 'The crimson figure rushes forward with open arms—her double-bladed lance clatters to the ground.'}
{3: 'The metallic scent of iron envelops you as her long hair cascades past your ears, gathering in the hollow of your neck.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vera', 3: "I can tell... you still haven't remembered everything.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "...So it's not time yet. Not time for me to say those words.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She holds you in a tight embrace, her arms locked around you like a vise.'}
{2: "I've already remembered a lot...", 3: '29'}
{2: 'I was surprised I could see fragments of those times through Eve just now...', 3: '30'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "There still isn't enough time.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vera releases her hold. That urgent embrace, like someone desperately trying to keep something from slipping away, vanishes as quickly as it came.'}
{3: 'She drops to one knee and tears open your blood-soaked clothing.'}
{3: 'The fabric, stuck fast to raw flesh, makes a sickening sound as she tears it away.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vera', 3: "...So, how's that Hetero-Creature date working out for you?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "Seeing how eager you are to get yourself killed, I thought maybe you'd fallen in love with the feeling of Punishing energy corroding your flesh.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vera quickly returns to her usual self—that familiar sharp tongue of hers bringing an almost comforting sense of normalcy.'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "If I'd synchronized even a moment later, the Punishing would have corroded right through your organs.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vera dumps nearly an entire bottle of disinfectant over the wound, then savagely jabs the serum injection into your injury.'}
{2: 'OWWW!! That hurts!!', 3: '58', 4: "Hiss... Don't take it out on me...", 5: '58'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'You never learn your lesson. This is exactly what you deserve.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vera lowers her gaze, yanks out some bandages, and tightly wraps several layers around your waist and injured leg.'}
{3: "You search Vera's eyes, as if looking for something familiar in those garnet-red irises."}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "Stop staring. I haven't changed. This frame looks exactly the same as it did back then—only the internal systems got a slight upgrade.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'But you have changed. Your shadow is different now.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Vera meets your gaze, your silhouette reflected in her eyes—not only are you more mature than the you of a few years ago, but you also bear traces of a weariness she wishes wasn't there."}
{2: 'Vera', 3: '...So we ended up like this again after all.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "Can you stand? No matter what you saw in my M.I.N.D., or what you've remembered yourself, we don't have time for reunions.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'First, explain our current situation to me clearly, especially about that smart-mouthed brat. Why did he leave you here? Was he running away, or was there another reason?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'No, he went to destroy the other embryos.'}
{3: 'As Vera lifts you up from the ground, you quickly explain the current situation:'}
{3: 'From how you and Haniff dragged Vera into this genetic repository, to the elderly researcher who severed ties with the Ascendants.'}
{3: 'You also describe how your group was discovered and ultimately cornered by the Ascendants.'}
{2: 'Those "evolving" Hetero-Creatures,', 3: '86'}
{2: 'all came from the hands of that researcher... Haynes.', 3: '87'}
{2: 'Based on his tone, there must be more embryos within the "Hollow" that have to be destroyed.', 3: '88'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vera', 3: 'Are you sure that old man is the new Haynes?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Even with only fragmentary memories,', 3: '91'}
{2: "...but he's identical to both Haynes in your memory data.", 3: '93', 4: "...but he's identical to the Haynes in my memory.", 5: '92'}
{2: 'I saw it when Eve analyzed my memories.', 3: '93'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: '...The human brain really is a flawed, fragile thing. Just a slight bump, and memories are so effortlessly discarded.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vera lets out an emotionless chuckle.'}
{2: 'No, even if the memories were messed up...', 3: '97'}
{2: 'I also went back to find you.', 4: 'I also went back to find traces of that memory.'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'What? You went back—', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vera just frowns and looks up when a crisp shattering sound comes from her hand. She has unconsciously crushed the empty serum vial.'}
{3: 'Among the tiny fragments scattered on the floor, Vera notices something and looks down again.'}
{3: 'Between her collarbones, the space where the "safety latch" should be is completely empty, as if mocking her with its absence.'}
{3: 'Even her frame seems to be urging her forward.'}
{3: "In an instant, your Mind Beacon experiences the intense sensation of falling. When memories are connected, the Construct's emotional fluctuations become much more perceptible."}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "It's nothing, I just couldn't control my strength. Similar things happened when adapting to the Garnet frame. It's perfectly normal.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Wait, let me check your M.I.N.D. again.', 3: '119'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "I don't need—", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vera brushes away your outstretched hand.'}

{2: 'Vera', 3: "Your wounds are patched up for now. We need to hurry and go after that one-armed brat. I don't trust him, and with his injuries, he might not be able to complete the mission.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "I'll carry you on my back. If you don't want to end up a cripple, stop walking.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vera cuts off any response you might have and pulls you onto her back.'}
{3: 'Finally, she steps forward once more.'}
